file_content.text: Commander Madine. I was told you wanted to speak with me.
Sobrik is free, and we have you to thank. A battalion should be in the city soon, though it'll be a long slog.
You've proven your commitment to Balmorra and the Republic. I've been authorized to ask for your help with a top secret mission.
We've already invaded Imperial territory and liberated Sobrik. What's left?
It must be important.
The Republic didn't even know this objective existed until the Empire forced us offworld. The Balmorrans hid it well.
I wasn't aware I was proving myself.
So this was all a test?
The satellite system and Imperial headquarters had to be dealt with. I'm just lucky you're the one responsible.
I want more info first.
Let me introduce Doctor Carsiri, a scientist at the Balmorran Arms Factory.
Lead scientist now, actually. Not that it matters--I don't lead armies or free cities like you.
Doctor Carsiri is braver than he admits. He's working on the whole reason the Empire's fighting for Balmorra--the Barrager planetary defense system.
What's so special about this weapon?
That's an impressive name.
You're taking a big risk talking to us, doctor.
Why cross the Empire for us?
With the Barrager, the Empire could hold Balmorra hostage forever.
It's not like the Empire to sit on a weapon.
Why aren't they using it?
It isn't finished yet, but it's close. That's why I contacted the commander. Now I wish I had done it sooner.
The last inside man I met was a traitor.
Can we trust the Doctor?
I'm a Balmorran and loyal to the Republic. I'll do anything to see the Empire gone.
We've shut down a satellite system and broken through a spaceport shield.
Big deal, another weapon.
This is different. This weapon guarantees victory for whoever controls it.
The Barrager can destroy an entire orbiting fleet without launching a single ship. The host planet becomes an impenetrable fortress.
We can't do anything to the Barrager unless we can control it. For that, we need someone who knows the weapon inside and out.
The weapon's designers are Doctor Meln and Doctor Ortis. They refused to work for the Empire and were imprisoned in the Gorinth Brig.
Are you certain they're alive?
Meln and Ortis might be dead.
The Gorinth Brig holds people who are inconvenient, not damned.
What exactly is the Gorinth Brig?
I've never heard of that place.
It's a brutal Imperial prison. Every scientist who refused to cooperate was sent there.
The Barrager's your work too.
I'm only a junior scientist. Having a gun to your head makes you work faster, but it doesn't make you work smarter.
Doctor Meln and Doctor Ortis are the only people who can get us the Barrager. They must get out of the Gorinth Brig safely.
My scout Wes Durga is on the Gorinth Plateau. Speak with him--he'll know how to get inside and free the doctors.
Be careful, Doctor Carsiri, or you might be next.
Our informant should lay low.
Don't worry, being a real-life traitor is making me extra cautious.
Can the other prisoners be freed?
What about the others inside?
I won't say no, but Doctor Meln, Doctor Ortis and the Barrager are our top priority.
If your doctors are in there, I'll find them.
You can count on me, sir.
That's why the Republic authorized me to ask you.
I always enjoy a good prison break.
Sounds like a fun time.
Then you'll be the only person who ever entered the Gorinth Brig happily.
I'm on my way now.
Keep me updated, Commander. I'll do what I can to keep the Empire busy here. Good luck.
I've been doing favors for you long enough.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
This isn't a favor! We're talking about saving Balmorra from the Empire!
[This comm station is inactive.]
Great, more hoops.
